title: Donald Trump on skipping 60 Minutes interview: 'Worst and most blatant scandal'
content: ​"I’ve done 60 Minutes many times, even back in the good ol’ days when Journalism was respected and legit, but I have never seen a very poor answer being REPLACED by another, totally unrelated answer, in order to save the person great personal and professional embarrassment," Donald Trump posted on Truth Social.
summary: ​"I’ve done 60 Minutes many times, even back in the good ol’ days when Journalism was respected and legit, but I have never seen a very poor answer being REPLACED by another, totally unrelated answer, in order to save the person great personal and professional embarrassment," Donald Trump posted on Truth Social.

title: ​'Lost generation': 400,000 children in Lebanon displaced in 3 weeks due to conflict with Israel
Kamala Harris eyes Joe Rogan podcast to win over young male voters
content: Democratic nominee Kamala Harris is considering an interview with Joe Rogan to gain support among young male voters. Rogan's podcast reaches millions and could be influential. Harris' campaign also targeted Black male voters and confirmed an interview with Fox News. Trump plans a Rogan appearance too, adding tension to the tight race.
summary: Democratic nominee Kamala Harris is considering an interview with Joe Rogan to gain support among young male voters. Rogan's podcast reaches millions and could be influential. Harris' campaign also targeted Black male voters and confirmed an interview with Fox News. Trump plans a Rogan appearance too, adding tension to the tight race.

title: What is Shaken Baby Syndrome, that might lead to Texas man's execution over daughter's death?
content: Robert Roberson, 57, is set to be executed in Texas for a murder conviction related to shaken baby syndrome. His lawyers, alongside experts, claim that the conviction was based on faulty evidence and undiagnosed medical issues. Despite new evidence, courts have denied appeals, raising concerns about the diagnosis' role in forensic science.
summary: Robert Roberson, 57, is set to be executed in Texas for a murder conviction related to shaken baby syndrome. His lawyers, alongside experts, claim that the conviction was based on faulty evidence and undiagnosed medical issues. Despite new evidence, courts have denied appeals, raising concerns about the diagnosis' role in forensic science.

title: Over 200 pro-Palestinian supporters arrested outside NY Stock Exchange
content: Police arrested over 200 pro-Palestinian protestors outside the New York Stock Exchange, demanding an end to US support for Israel's military actions in Gaza. Protesters, organized by various activist groups, chanted slogans against US defense contractors and raised concerns over alleged genocide. A smaller group of pro-Israel supporters also gathered at the site.
summary: Police arrested over 200 pro-Palestinian protestors outside the New York Stock Exchange, demanding an end to US support for Israel's military actions in Gaza. Protesters, organized by various activist groups, chanted slogans against US defense contractors and raised concerns over alleged genocide. A smaller group of pro-Israel supporters also gathered at the site.

title: Harry and Meghan 'trial separation': Prince reportedly leading separate life from 'control freak' Markle
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are reportedly drifting apart with Harry leading solo outings and embracing a different energy. Harry seems to rediscover his happiness away from Meghan, causing speculation about a trial separation as they navigate their individual desires and futures amidst challenges in their marriage and professional lives.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are reportedly drifting apart with Harry leading solo outings and embracing a different energy. Harry seems to rediscover his happiness away from Meghan, causing speculation about a trial separation as they navigate their individual desires and futures amidst challenges in their marriage and professional lives.

title: Washington's National Zoo welcomes two giant Pandas from China
content: The Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, DC, is set to welcome two energetic giant pandas, Bao Li and Qing Bao, from China. Born in 2021, they start a new chapter in panda conservation efforts. This arrival coincides with heightened U.S.-China diplomatic ties and is part of a broader initiative to protect the vulnerable species.
summary: The Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, DC, is set to welcome two energetic giant pandas, Bao Li and Qing Bao, from China. Born in 2021, they start a new chapter in panda conservation efforts. This arrival coincides with heightened U.S.-China diplomatic ties and is part of a broader initiative to protect the vulnerable species.

title: 2,000-year-old tomb with 12 skeletons discovered in Jordan
content: Archaeologists uncover a 2,000-year-old tomb beneath Petra's Treasury in Jordan, revealing 12 skeletons and well-preserved artifacts. Led by Dr. Pearce Paul Creasman, the team explores the significance of the burial site and its insights into Nabataean culture and history.
summary: Archaeologists uncover a 2,000-year-old tomb beneath Petra's Treasury in Jordan, revealing 12 skeletons and well-preserved artifacts. Led by Dr. Pearce Paul Creasman, the team explores the significance of the burial site and its insights into Nabataean culture and history.

title: Record 153 Chinese military aircraft fly around Taiwan airspace
content: Taiwan detected 153 Chinese military aircraft around its airspace in a single day, setting a record. The maneuvers occurred amid high tensions and followed China's large-scale military drills. Taiwan and the U.S. condemned the actions, while Japan expressed concerns. Taiwan's President vowed to protect the island's democracy and sovereignty.
summary: Taiwan detected 153 Chinese military aircraft around its airspace in a single day, setting a record. The maneuvers occurred amid high tensions and followed China's large-scale military drills. Taiwan and the U.S. condemned the actions, while Japan expressed concerns. Taiwan's President vowed to protect the island's democracy and sovereignty.

title: North Korea blows up inter-Korean roads amid rising tensions with South
content: North Korea has dismantled sections of inter-Korean roads on its side of the border, signaling a further deterioration in inter-Korean relations. This move, along with accusations against South Korea of flying drones over Pyongyang, heightens tensions and prompts military readiness between the two nations.
summary: North Korea has dismantled sections of inter-Korean roads on its side of the border, signaling a further deterioration in inter-Korean relations. This move, along with accusations against South Korea of flying drones over Pyongyang, heightens tensions and prompts military readiness between the two nations.

title: 'Canadian Sikhs stalked by fear,' claims NDP's Jagmeet Singh, calls for sanctions against India
content: Amidst tensions between India and Canada over the murder of Hardeep Singh Nijjar, New Democratic Party (NDP) leader Jagmeet Singh urged the Canadian government to take action against India, specifically calling for diplomat sanctions and a ban on the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) Network in Canada.
summary: Amidst tensions between India and Canada over the murder of Hardeep Singh Nijjar, New Democratic Party (NDP) leader Jagmeet Singh urged the Canadian government to take action against India, specifically calling for diplomat sanctions and a ban on the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) Network in Canada.

title: Nasa launches Europa Clipper to explore potential life on Jupiter's moon
content: Nasa launched the Europa Clipper spacecraft to explore Jupiter's moon Europa, aiming to investigate its subsurface ocean for habitability. The mission, costing $5.2 billion, features nine instruments to study Europa's environment, expecting to reach Jupiter by 2030, and conduct 49 flybys over four years.
summary: Nasa launched the Europa Clipper spacecraft to explore Jupiter's moon Europa, aiming to investigate its subsurface ocean for habitability. The mission, costing $5.2 billion, features nine instruments to study Europa's environment, expecting to reach Jupiter by 2030, and conduct 49 flybys over four years.

title: Kamala shares montage of Trump at Pennsylvania rally, slams 'enemy from within' remark
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris criticizes Donald Trump in a Pennsylvania rally, warning against his potential re-election. She shares a montage of Trump's speeches discussing the threats posed by 'enemies within' and his willingness to use military force against them, targeting journalists and election officials.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris criticizes Donald Trump in a Pennsylvania rally, warning against his potential re-election. She shares a montage of Trump's speeches discussing the threats posed by 'enemies within' and his willingness to use military force against them, targeting journalists and election officials.

title: Diddy's infamous 'White Parties' were hotbeds for sexual assault: New lawsuits
content: Sean 'Diddy' Combs faces new sexual assault allegations linked to various incidents at his 'White Parties', a Manhattan hotel, and a Macy's stockroom. Attorney Tony Buzbee represents six unidentified victims and plans more lawsuits. Diddy is currently in detention, awaiting trial in 2025 on multiple charges, including racketeering and sex trafficking.
summary: Sean 'Diddy' Combs faces new sexual assault allegations linked to various incidents at his 'White Parties', a Manhattan hotel, and a Macy's stockroom. Attorney Tony Buzbee represents six unidentified victims and plans more lawsuits. Diddy is currently in detention, awaiting trial in 2025 on multiple charges, including racketeering and sex trafficking.

title: Facebook and Instagram outages impact thousands in US
content: Meta platforms' Facebook and Instagram faced significant outages across the US on Monday, with users reporting over 8,000 issues for Facebook and 4,000 for Instagram around 1:44 pm ET. Most services were restored by 2:09 pm ET. Earlier this year, a global Meta outage affected hundreds of thousands of users for over two hours.
summary: Meta platforms' Facebook and Instagram faced significant outages across the US on Monday, with users reporting over 8,000 issues for Facebook and 4,000 for Instagram around 1:44 pm ET. Most services were restored by 2:09 pm ET. Earlier this year, a global Meta outage affected hundreds of thousands of users for over two hours.

title: King Charles pauses cancer treatment for Australian tour
content: King Charles temporarily pauses cancer treatment for an 11-day tour of Australia with Queen Camilla, as doctors clear him with a reduced schedule. The visit aims to strengthen ties amidst rising republican sentiments. Meanwhile, Prince William and Princess Kate increasingly step up, raising speculation about a power shift within the royal family.
summary: King Charles temporarily pauses cancer treatment for an 11-day tour of Australia with Queen Camilla, as doctors clear him with a reduced schedule. The visit aims to strengthen ties amidst rising republican sentiments. Meanwhile, Prince William and Princess Kate increasingly step up, raising speculation about a power shift within the royal family.

title: Kamala Harris' policy list: 'Opportunity Agenda for Black Men' to win voters. Details here.
content: Kamala Harris revealed an economic initiative, the 'Opportunity Agenda for Black men,' targeting Black business owners with forgivable loans and national marijuana legalization for economic inclusion. Aiming to regain Black male support before the November election, her agenda also covers cryptocurrency regulations, educational opportunities, and a health equity initiative.
summary: Kamala Harris revealed an economic initiative, the 'Opportunity Agenda for Black men,' targeting Black business owners with forgivable loans and national marijuana legalization for economic inclusion. Aiming to regain Black male support before the November election, her agenda also covers cryptocurrency regulations, educational opportunities, and a health equity initiative.

title: 'Honestly kind of shocking': GOP leader Anna Paulina Luna surprised by Biden's Hurricane response
content: Republican Anna Paulina Luna praised President Biden for his proactive response to Hurricane Milton's impact on her Florida district. Despite her past criticisms, Luna appreciated Biden's efforts in disaster aid reforms and FEMA's performance, advocating for changes to improve federal disaster response.
summary: Republican Anna Paulina Luna praised President Biden for his proactive response to Hurricane Milton's impact on her Florida district. Despite her past criticisms, Luna appreciated Biden's efforts in disaster aid reforms and FEMA's performance, advocating for changes to improve federal disaster response.

title: JD Vance slams Kamala Harris for allegedly using Wikipedia to write her book
content: US vice president Kamala Harris is accused of plagiarism in her 2009 book 'Smart on Crime,' allegedly copying sections from uncited sources, including Wikipedia and news reports. Conservative writer Christopher Rufo and Austrian plagiarism expert Stefan Weber highlight over a dozen instances, raising concerns about the integrity of Harris's work. Senator JD Vance also criticized Harris publicly.
summary: US vice president Kamala Harris is accused of plagiarism in her 2009 book 'Smart on Crime,' allegedly copying sections from uncited sources, including Wikipedia and news reports. Conservative writer Christopher Rufo and Austrian plagiarism expert Stefan Weber highlight over a dozen instances, raising concerns about the integrity of Harris's work. Senator JD Vance also criticized Harris publicly.

title: Kamala Harris will give an interview to not-so-friendly Fox News. Details here
content: Kamala Harris Fox interview: The interview will take place near Philadelphia on Wednesday shortly before it gets aired at 6 PM Eastern Time at Bret Baier's "Special Report". The vice president will sit for 25 to 30 minutes. Bret Baier is the chief political anchor at the network. This will be Kamala Harris's first formal interview with Fox News.
summary: Kamala Harris Fox interview: The interview will take place near Philadelphia on Wednesday shortly before it gets aired at 6 PM Eastern Time at Bret Baier's "Special Report". The vice president will sit for 25 to 30 minutes. Bret Baier is the chief political anchor at the network.  This will be Kamala Harris's first formal interview with Fox News.
